results.headline: Meth and Mayhem Out West
results.summary_short: Ward Roberts stages beatdowns, chase scenes and face-offs in “Dust Up.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dust Up

results.headline: Souls Tangled Up in Time
results.summary_short: “Cloud Atlas,” which lavishly adapts the David Mitchell novel, is a film about migratory souls and wayward civilizations, loaded with soaring themes and flights of feeling.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cloud Atlas

results.headline: Surf’s Up, but the Rest of Life Can Really Drag a Guy Down
results.summary_short: In “Chasing Mavericks,” Gerard Butler takes a young surfer under his wing to tutor him in the ways of a famed California surf break.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chasing Mavericks

results.headline: A Pop Culture Father Figure, as Mellow as His Tone
results.summary_short: “The Zen of Bennett,” Unjoo Moon’s documentary about the singer Tony Bennett, was assembled during the production sessions for Mr. Bennett’s blockbuster album, “Duets II.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Zen of Bennett

results.headline: Glum Teenager Flies Pink-Painted Coop
results.summary_short: In “Sassy Pants” an oppressed teenager flees the suffocating home of her prudish mother to live with her divorced father and his younger gay lover and pursue fashion.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sassy Pants

results.headline: Courtship, Wedding, Existential Whimsy
results.summary_short: “Le Grand Amour,” directed by Pierre Etaix, is a comic meditation about that thing called love and the flights of fancy it inspires.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Le Grand Amour

results.headline: Therapy at Its Most Touching
results.summary_short: “The Sessions” is a touching, profoundly sex-positive film that equates sex with intimacy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Sessions

results.headline: On One Coin, a Swastika and a Star of David
results.summary_short: The discovery of an odd coin — a swastika on one side, a Star of David on the other — leads the director of “The Flat,” a documentary, on an investigation into his family history.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Flat

results.headline: The Game Is All-Consuming, at Least Until the Outside World Intrudes
results.summary_short: The documentary “Brooklyn Castle,” directed by Katie Dellamaggiore, follows the chess-playing students of Intermediate School 318.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brooklyn Castle

results.headline: Women Know: The Downward Dog Is Good for You
results.summary_short: In the West, women in particular have taken to the values of yoga, as explained in the documentary “Yogawoman.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Yogawoman

results.headline: Keyboard Activists in the Online Universe
results.summary_short: “We Are Legion” looks at a new generation of hackers turned activists.
results.display_title: We are Legion: The Story of the Hacktivists

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of We are Legion: The Story of the Hacktivists

results.headline: Raging Hormones and Soul-Searching Conversations
results.summary_short: In “The First Time,” Jonathan Kasdan brings a freshness to the old story of high school students pondering love and virginity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The First Time

results.headline: Bawling, Brawling and Boy-Crazy
results.summary_short: That’s What She Said” stars Anne Heche and Marcia DeBonis as the kind of best friends found only in fiction.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of That's What She Said

results.headline: The Steps of Michael Jackson’s ‘Bad’
results.summary_short: Spike Lee compiles clips and interviews to present a buoyant picture of Michael Jackson in “Bad 25,” celebrating the 25th anniversary of Jackson’s follow-up to “Thriller.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bad 25

results.headline: Women Watch Women Who Want to Be Sexual
results.summary_short: The documentary “Sexy Baby” looks at the effects of Internet pornography on women and a 12-year-old girl.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sexy Baby

results.headline: Same-Sex Marriage: What Both Halves Think
results.summary_short: Joe Fox and James Nubile’s documentary “Question One” is determined to give equal weight to both sides in the battle over same-sex marriage in Maine.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Question One

results.headline: Break Up a Family? Why Not, I’ve Got Nothing Better to Do
results.summary_short: In “Nobody Walks,” a young artist living with a Los Angeles family throws it into chaos when she has an affair with the father.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nobody Walks

results.headline: My Handyman, With a French Accent
results.summary_short: In Anne Fontaine’s new film, “My Worst Nightmare,” the handyman seduces the lady of the house, whose partner has left her for the handyman’s social worker.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Worst Nightmare

results.headline: Going Solo From a Family of Friends
results.summary_short: A family of young female roommates is changed when one moves out in the French film “La Vie au Ranch,” given an improvised feel with nonprofessional actors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of La vie au ranch

results.headline: Mystical Tai Chi Against a Giant Machine
results.summary_short: In “Tai Chi Zero,” a village of martial-arts experts battles the forces of modernity.
